metadata.bio:
Jenevieve Johnson (born January 30, 1998), simply known as Jenevieve, is an American singer and songwriter of Cuban and Bahamian descent currently based in Los Angeles. Raised in Miami, she has a background in dance through her mother and grandmother who were both ballet dancers.

In February 2020, Jenevieve debuted with "Medallion" under independent label Joyface/Interscope Records. This was followed by her critically acclaimed track "Baby Powder" in March, which gained millions of streams and landed on major playlists, solidifying her as a rising talent in R&B. Both tracks appeared on her 2021 debut album Division. In 2022, she released Division (Deluxe), her debut EP Rendezvous - EP, and ended the year with an original Christmas song titled "Christmas Special".
